name: Aztec Mythology
tagline: The Fifth Sun and Sacred Warfare
description: Explore Aztec myths of the Five Suns, Quetzalcoatl the Feathered Serpent, and ritual sacrifice sustaining the cosmos.
overview: Aztec mythology centers on cyclical creation and destruction, with humanity currently living in the Fifth Sun era. The cosmos requires constant nourishment through ritual sacrifice to prevent cosmic collapse. Major deities include Huitzilopochtli (sun/war god and patron of Tenochtitlan), Quetzalcoatl (Feathered Serpent, wisdom and wind), Tezcatlipoca (Smoking Mirror, destiny and sorcery), and Tlaloc (rain and fertility). The tradition emphasizes: tonalli (life force), sacred warfare for captives, the Templo Mayor as cosmic mountain, calendar systems, and the Fifth Sun's inevitable destruction by earthquakes.

sections.title: The Five Suns
sections.body:
Four previous worlds (Suns) were created and destroyed:
1. **Jaguar Sun** - destroyed by jaguars
2. **Wind Sun** - destroyed by hurricanes
3. **Rain Sun** - destroyed by fiery rain
4. **Water Sun** - destroyed by flood
5. **Earthquake Sun** (current) - will be destroyed by earthquakes

Each sun represents a cosmic age with different humanity and different sustaining deity.
